sen.j: 幸阿弥派（こうあみは）は、漆芸の蒔絵師の流派。
sen.e: The Koami school is a group of gold lacquer masters engaging in Shitsugei (lacquer art).
The Koami school is a group of maki-e masters engaging in Shitsugei (lacquer art).

sen.j: 五十嵐派と並ぶ、御用蒔絵の二大流派。
sen.e: The Koami school and the Igarashi school are two major schools assuming the honorary post of Goyo-makie (person or group allowed to purvey makie (Japanese lacquer sprinkled with gold or silver powder) to the government or the Imperial Court).
The Koami school and the Igarashi school are the two major schools assuming the honorary post of Goyo-maki-e (people allowed to provide maki-e to the Imperial Court).

sen.j: 室町時代に土岐四郎左衛門道長が足利義政の近習になり、出家して幸阿弥を名のった。
sen.e: Shirozaemon Michinaga TOKI, a kinju (attendant) of Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA, became a priest called Koami in the Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。

sen.e: His descendant adopted the name "Koami" as a family name.
